New Records: Netherlands bowler Paul van Meekeren took 4 wickets for 23 runs in 7.2 overs
Key Match Events: Bangladesh was bowled out for 142 runs in 42.2 overs
Bas de Leede's sharp throw ran out Mahedi Hasan
Mustafizur Rahman ended the Dutch skipper's chancy innings
Logan van Beek played a cameo of 23 not out from 16 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh wanted to revive their campaign after losing four games on the trot
Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards emphasized the importance of playing a good team game
Post-Match Reflections: The result meant the Netherlands, an associate ICC member, now sit above defending champions England and Bangladesh in the point table
Bas de Leede's contribution of 17 runs with the bat also became pivotal in the context of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 39-year-old Wesley Barresi showed the way in his run-a-ball knock, milking the attack of Taskin and Shoriful in effortless fashion
Taskin Ahmed, who missed their matches against India and South Africa because of a sore shoulder, dismissed Vikramjit Singh in his opening over
Others: The match was played at Eden Gardens in Kolkata
The crowd was strongly rooting for Bangladesh
